column4: hey, im having problems installing my nvidia graphics card, http://pastebin.com/d7e420704 can someone help me please?
what graphics card are you using?
nvidia geforce 210
well its saying that your particular chip isnt supported by the 180.44 driver... what version of ubuntu are you on?
you should be able to install the 185 driver, System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers

earlier two people told me just to install whatever the newest nvidia driver was, and 180 sounded good so i did that. i have no clue what im doing. i just installed ubuntu the other day, still reading through this massive book trying to learn
180 isnt the newest :)
the hardware driver program says "no proprietary drivers are in use on this system"
note: i rebooted, and now i am running in low graphics mode
you ashould be able to activate 185 from that menu
that menu has absolutely no options at all.
ok that isnt good, I dont know why it wouldn't show up.
how do i uninstall the incorrect drivers that i have?
What did you do to install it?
sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-180
sudo apt-get remove nvidia-glx-180
ok and you say i should install 185?
yes

futurama140@futurama140-desktop:~$ sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-185 Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree        Reading state information... Done E: Couldn't find package nvidia-glx-185
im not sure how to install the driver im talking about from the command line, I always use the gui. just a sec
you need to run sudo apt-get update
i updated, now what?
I recommend upgrading to ubuntu 9.10 then, looks like 9.04 is outdated
